Default.title: Default
Default.description: Object to signify when the default value of a visual interface should be used.

a.title: A
a.description: Value for the alpha channel, which defines the opacity as a number between 0 (fully transparent) and 255 (fully opaque).

n.title: N
n.description: Plane normal as 3 (x, y, z) values.

o.title: O
o.description: Plane origin as 3 (x, y, z) values

x.title: X
x.description: Plane x-axis as 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it is autocalculated.

min.title: Min
min.description: A number to set the lower boundary of the legend. If Default, the minimum of the values associated with the legend will be used.

max.title: Max
max.description: A number to set the upper boundary of the legend. If Default, the maximum of the values associated with the legend will be used.

segment_count.title: Segment Count
segment_count.description: An integer representing the number of steps between the high and low boundary of the legend. The default is set to 11 or it will be equal to the number of items in the ordinal_dictionary. Any custom values input in here should always be greater than or equal to 2.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: An list of color objects. Default is the Ladybug original colorset.

title.title: Title
title.description: Text string for Legend title. Typically, the units of the data are used here but the type of data might also be used.

base_plane.title: Base Plane
base_plane.description: A Ladybug Plane object to note the starting point from where the legend will be generated. The default is the world XY plane at origin (0, 0, 0).

continuous_legend.title: Continuous Legend
continuous_legend.description: Boolean noting whether legend is drawn as a gradient or discrete segments.

ordinal_dictionary.title: Ordinal Dictionary
ordinal_dictionary.description: Optional dictionary that maps values to text categories. If None, numerical values will be used for the legend segments. If not, text categories will be used and the legend will be ordinal. Note that, if the number of items in the dictionary are less than the segment_count, some segments will not receive any label. Examples for possible dictionaries include: {-1: "Cold", 0: "Neutral", 1: "Hot"}, {0: "False", 1: "True"}

decimal_count.title: Decimal Count
decimal_count.description: An an integer for the number of decimal places in the legend text. Note that this input has no bearing on the resulting legend text when an ordinal_dictionary is present.

include_larger_smaller.title: Include Larger Smaller
include_larger_smaller.description: Boolean noting whether > and < should be included in legend segment text.

vertical.title: Vertical
vertical.description: Boolean noting whether legend is vertical (True) or horizontal (False).

segment_height.title: Segment Height
segment_height.description: A number to set the height for each of the legend segments.

segment_width.title: Segment Width
segment_width.description: A number to set the width for each of the legend segments.

text_height.title: Text Height
text_height.description: A number to set the height for the legend text. Default is 1/3 of the segment_height.

font.title: Font
font.description: Text string to set the font for the legend text. Examples include "Arial", "Times New Roman", "Courier". Note that this parameter may not have an effect on certain interfaces that have limited access to fonts.

LegendParameters.title: LegendParameters
LegendParameters.description: Legend parameters used to customize legends.

center.title: Center
center.description: The center of the sphere as 3 (x, y, z) values.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: A number representing the radius of the sphere.

edge_indices.title: Edge Indices
edge_indices.description: An array objects that each contain two integers. These integers correspond to indices within the vertices list and each tuple represents a line segment for an edge of the polyface.

edge_types.title: Edge Types
edge_types.description: An array of integers for each edge that parallels the edge_indices list. An integer of 0 denotes a naked edge, an integer of 1 denotes an internal edge. Anything higher is a non-manifold edge.

data_type.description: Text to indicate the type of data. This governs the behavior of the data type and the acceptable units. The DataTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

name.title: Name
name.description: Text to indicate how the data type displays. This can be more specific than the data_type.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the mesh. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

faces.title: Faces
faces.description: A list of lists with each sub-list having either 3 or 4 integers. These integers correspond to indices within the list of vertices.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: An optional list of colors that correspond to either the faces of the mesh or the vertices of the mesh.

p.title: P
p.description: Line segment base point as 2 (x, y) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Line segment direction vector as 2 (x, y) values.

LineSegment2D.title: LineSegment2D
LineSegment2D.description: A single line segment face in 2D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the mesh. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

faces.title: Faces
faces.description: A list of lists with each sub-list having either 3 or 4 integers. These integers correspond to indices within the list of vertices.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: An optional list of colors that correspond to either the faces of the mesh or the vertices of the mesh.

vertex.title: Vertex
vertex.description: The point at the tip of the cone as 3 (x, y, z) values.

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: The vector representing the direction of the cone as 3 (x, y, z) values. The vector extends from the vertex to the center of the base.

angle.title: Angle
angle.description: An angle in radians representing the half angle between the axis and the surface.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: A Plane in which the arc lies with an origin representing the center of the circle for the arc.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: A number representing the radius of the arc.

a1.title: A1
a1.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the start angle of the arc.

a2.title: A2
a2.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the end angle of the arc.

Arc3D.title: Arc3D
Arc3D.description: A single arc or circle in 3D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the the vertices of the polyline. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

interpolated.title: Interpolated
interpolated.description: A boolean to note whether the polyline should be interpolated between the input vertices when it is translated to other interfaces.

center.title: Center
center.description: The center of the bottom base of the cylinder as 3 (x, y, z) values.

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: The vector representing the direction of the cylinder as 3 (x, y, z) values. The vector extends from the bottom base center to the top base center.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: A number representing the radius of the cylinder.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the the vertices of the polyline. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

interpolated.title: Interpolated
interpolated.description: A boolean to note whether the polyline should be interpolated between the input vertices when it is translated to other interfaces.

c.title: C
c.description: Center of the arc as 2 (x, y) values.

r.title: R
r.description: A number representing the radius of the arc.

a1.title: A1
a1.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the start angle of the arc.

a2.title: A2
a2.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the end angle of the arc.

Arc2D.title: Arc2D
Arc2D.description: A single arc or circle in 2D space.

p.title: P
p.description: Ray base point as 3 (x, y, z) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Ray direction vector as 3 (x, y, z) values.

p.title: P
p.description: Ray base point as 2 (x, y) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Ray direction vector as 2 (x, y) values.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the polyface. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

face_indices.title: Face Indices
face_indices.description: A list of lists with one list for each face of the polyface. Each face list must contain at least one sub-list of integers corresponding to indices within the vertices list. Additional sub-lists of integers may follow this one such that the first sub-list denotes the boundary of the face while each subsequent sub-list denotes a hole in the face.

edge_information.title: Edge Information
edge_information.description: Optional edge information, which will speed up the creation of the Polyface object if it is available but should be left as None if it is unknown. If None, edge_information will be computed from the vertices and face_indices inputs.

p.title: P
p.description: Line segment base point as 3 (x, y, z) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Line segment direction vector as 3 (x, y, z) values.

LineSegment3D.title: LineSegment3D
LineSegment3D.description: A single line segment face in 3D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the polygon. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

boundary.title: Boundary
boundary.description: A list of points representing the outer boundary vertices of the face. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

holes.title: Holes
holes.description: Optional list of lists with one list for each hole in the face.Each hole should be a list of at least 3 points and each point a list of 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it will be assumed that there are no holes in the face.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: Optional Plane indicating the plane in which the face exists.If None, the plane will usually be derived from the boundary points.

Face3D.title: Face3D
Face3D.description: A single planar face in 3D space.

values.title: Values
values.description: An list of numerical values that will be used to generate the legend and colors.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: An optional ladybug-geometry object (or list of ladybug-geometry objects) that is aligned with the input values. If a Mesh or Polyface is specified here, it is expected that the number of values match the number of faces or the number of vertices. If a list of geometry objects is specified (ie. a list of Point3Ds), it is expected that the length of this list align with the number of values.

min_point.title: Min Point
min_point.description: A Point3D object for the minimum of the bounding box around the graphic geometry. If None, then there must be an input for geometry and the bounding box around this geometry will be used to set up the graphic container.

max_point.title: Max Point
max_point.description: A Point3D object for the maximum of the  bounding box around the graphic geometry. If None, then there must be an input for geometry and the bounding box around this geometry will be used to set up the graphic container.

legend_parameters.title: Legend Parameters
legend_parameters.description: An Optional LegendParameters object to override default parameters of the legend. None indicates that default legend parameters will be used.

data_type.title: Data Type
data_type.description: Optional DataType from the ladybug datatype subpackage (ie. Temperature()) , which will be used to assign default legend properties. If None, the legend associated with this object will contain no units unless a unit below is specified.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: Optional text string for the units of the values. (ie. "C"). If None, the default units of the data_type will be used.

GraphicContainer.title: GraphicContainer
GraphicContainer.description: Graphic container used to get legends, titles, and colors for any graphic.

type.title: Type
type.description: A base class to use when there is no baseclass available to fall on.
